Tucson spots it as well and turns up his high beams to get a better look at=
 what's ahead.  Straight Shot too, looks forward as does Quickstride, who d=
oesn't keep his eyes off the front windshield.

For the most part Tucson Pr=
ime had kept his promise to keep everyone safe.  He wasn't about to put his=
 comrades and Perceptor into any more perril.  He locks and loads a few bla=
st cannons located on either side of his front cab, just below the head lig=
hts, just in case he may have need of them.  Quickstride aims outside the p=
assenger's side window, as Straight Shot gathers back her courage and aims =
out the driver's side with her forearm affixed to what ever target was movi=
ng in on them.  Yet, knowing that Tucson was in charge, Straight Shot and Q=
uickstride wait for Tucson to say the first words.  

Steam vents out the h=
ydraulic systems which connect his front cab to his trailer with a loud his=
s.  He then pivots his tires to the right, and makes a firm stance in parke=
d position.  His engine idols with a rumbling noise.

" We know you're appr=
oaching our location.  You will show and identify yourself immediately.  If=
 you do not comply, I will be forced to terminate you!  You have thirty ast=
ro seconds to come forward!"

This was it, Tucson Prime was not fooling aro=
und.  More and more his demeanor, and tone of voice resounds more and more =
like Optimus Prime. His physical features, although silver and black in col=
or, also nearly resemble those of the legendary Autobot leader.  He doesn't=
 cower, and does not move, letting whoever was out there know, that they we=
ren't about to scare him off.
